intro: Leucas collina, commonly known as white leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Leucas collina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
